page.title: 03ANIMALS AT MID-DOD
page.content: The{farming}includes 150 ewes. Their lambs are kept until a certain age and are then fattened and sold at Forfar{ {Market.}On the farm there are also a few cows, their calves are sold in Kirriemuir where the new owner will fatten them and sell them for meat. {CHANGES}-Once the owner of Mid-Dod leased another 2 farms. Now the owner farms all 3 himself. Fields have also become larger. The number of workers has decreased due to the introduction of machinery. {PROBLEMS}-The wind lifts the top soil creating great difficulties. Also the drainage is very old. This means the soil can become damp. If machinery damages the pipes they are just replaced. Another problem is frost. Most crops are planted in Autumn and have to survive the Winter. If the frost is too hard the crop can ruin.
